Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Seminalplasmin (SPLN, calcium transporter inhibitor, caltrin, metallo-AMPs; natural AMPs; cattle, ruminant, mammals; animals, UCLL1; BBII, BBglycanMOA)

Literature Information.Literature: Two short antibacterial fragments have been identifed, one of them is hemolytic (Sitaram et al 1997 FEBS Lett 400: 289-292). It binds to calmodulin in the presence of Ca2+.Activity: Active against E. coli W160-37 (MIC 20-30 ug/ml), P. putida NCIM 2102 (MIC 20 ug/ml), S. aureus PEP 4/3 (MIC < 50 ug/ml), and B. subtilis (MIC 20-30 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria: it inhibits the synthesis of peptidoglycan in E. coli (Chitnis et al 1990 FEMS Microbiol Lett 60: 281-284).Updated 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Theil R, Scheit KH.1983
Literature Information.Title: Amino acid sequence of seminalplasmin, an antimicrobial protein from bull semen.
